alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Cumberland; Grundy; Van Buren; Warren; White (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 12:04PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Cumberland, Van Buren, Warren, southern Coffee, Grundy and southern White Counties through 1245 PM CDT... At 1204 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Spencer to 8 miles southeast of McMinnville to near Estill Springs. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... McMinnville, Manchester, Sparta, Spencer, Tullahoma, Gruetli-Laager, Tracy City, Monteagle, Altamont, Coalmont, Crab Orchard, Morrison, Palmer, Doyle, Beersheba Springs, Viola, Virgin Falls State Natural Area, Rock Island State Park, Indian Rock Lake and Summitville. Bonnaroo will also be impacted. This includes Interstate 24 between mile markers 111 and 136. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for Middle Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Coffee; Cumberland; Grundy; Van Buren; Warren; White
